text:
In this video, you’ll see how you can 
use AWS Resilience Hub with Terraform.

You’ll learn how to upload Terraform to 
Amazon Simple Storage Service (Amazon S3),

run Resilience Hub against the Terraform 
bucket, and submit the application.

We’ll begin in Amazon S3, where we 
have already configured a bucket for
the purposes of this demonstration.

As you can see, our bucket 
contains a Terraform state file.
Now let’s go to AWS Resilience Hub

and add our application so 
we can assess its resiliency.

As you can see, Resilience Hub now has 
an option for adding Terraform state files.

Let’s choose this option 
and then select our S3 bucket.
Next, we’ll select the Terraform state file.
Let’s name the application and continue.

Our Terraform state file has imported and 
now Resilience Hub is loading its resources.
Next, let’s select the ECS service for inclusion.
Next, let’s select a policy.

Resiliency policies define the 
Recovery Time Objective (RTO)
and Recovery Point Objective (RPO)

used to measure an application's
resiliency to certain disruption types.

For our purposes, we’ll choose
the Mission critical policy.

Next, let’s review the information 
and publish the application.
Now that the application has been published,

let’s run an assessment to uncover 
potential resiliency weaknesses.

The assessment shows that our 
resiliency policy has been breached.
Let’s take a closer look.

We can see the RTO is 
unrecoverable in our region.

Next, let’s view the 
resiliency recommendations.

The recommended changes 
include adding Auto Scaling groups

and capacity providers in 
multiple Availability Zones (AZs),

adding a service replication in another 
region, changing the desired count of

the setup, and configuring Amazon 
Elastic Container Registry (Amazon ECR)

replication to copy images 
to ECR in other regions.

You’ve just seen how you can use 
AWS Resilience Hub with Terraform.

You can learn more about this topic in 
the description and links for this video.
Thanks for watching. Now it’s your turn to try.
